lines.text: I'm a man of few, but firm, words.
You will be so beautiful that the first boy who sees you will want to marry you.
Nacha! Don't say that. As my youngest daughter, Tita will care for me until the day I die. She won't marry.
My aunt is as deaf as a post.
Then how can she carry on conversations?
She reads lips, but when she is eating, she is too preoccupied to notice anything else. Watch.
Tia Mary, I'm marrying Tita because the poor girl is crazy.
Sergeant, can you cook cream fritters?
To be honest ... no. But if you want, I will try.
You have never let me down before. I hope this will not be the first time.

[to Mama Elena]
Roberto's death is your fault!
I see you didn't touch your dinner. Sue Ellen is a horrible cook, but my son and I put up with her food. Of course, *you* don't have to.
If you were still in love with Pedro, you wouldn't be marrying John.
I don't know where Gertrudis got her sense of rhythm. Mother didn't like to dance, and Dad was a bad dancer.
